verses.verse: Now the Philistines<WH6430> fought<WH3898> against Israel:<WH3478> and the men<WH376> of Israel<WH3478> fled<WH5127> from before<WH6440> the Philistines,<WH6430> and fell down<WH5307> slain<WH2491> on Mount<WH2022> Gilboa.<WH1533>

The Philistines<WH6430> followed hard<WH1692> after<WH310> Saul<WH7586> and after<WH310> his sons;<WH1121> and the Philistines<WH6430> killed<WH5221> Jonathan,<WH3129> and Abinadab,<WH41> and Malchishua,<WH4444> the sons<WH1121> of Saul.<WH7586>
The battle<WH4421> went hard<WH3513> against Saul,<WH7586> and the archers<WH3384> overtook<WH4672> him;<WH2342> and he was distressed by reason of the archers.<WH3384>

Then Saul<WH7586> said<WH559> to his armor bearer,<WH5375> "Draw<WH8025> your sword,<WH2719> and thrust<WH1856> me through with it,<WH6189> lest these uncircumcised come<WH935> and abuse<WH5953> me.<WH5375>" But his armor bearer would<WH14> not;<WH3966> for he was terrified.<WH3372> Therefore Saul<WH7586> took<WH3947> his sword,<WH2719> and fell on it.<WH5307>
When his armor bearer<WH5375> saw<WH7200> that Saul<WH7586> was dead,<WH4191> he likewise fell<WH5307> on his sword,<WH2719> and died.<WH4191>
So Saul<WH7586> died,<WH4191> and his three<WH7969> sons;<WH1121> and all his house<WH1004> died<WH4191> together.<WH3162>

When all the men<WH376> of Israel<WH3478> who were in the valley<WH6010> saw<WH7200> that they fled,<WH5127> and that Saul<WH7586> and his sons<WH1121> were dead,<WH4191> they forsook<WH5800> their cities,<WH5892> and fled;<WH5127> and the Philistines<WH6430> came<WH935> and lived in them.<WH3427>

It happened on the next day,<WH4283> when the Philistines<WH6430> came<WH935> to strip<WH6584> the slain,<WH2491> that they found<WH4672> Saul<WH7586> and his sons<WH1121> fallen<WH5307> on Mount<WH2022> Gilboa.<WH1533>

They stripped<WH6584> him,<WH5375> and took his head,<WH7218> and his armor,<WH3627> and sent<WH7971> into the land<WH776> of the Philistines<WH6430> all around,<WH5439> to carry the news<WH1319> to their idols,<WH6091> and to the people.<WH5971>
They put<WH7760> his armor<WH3627> in the house<WH1004> of their gods,<WH430> and fastened<WH8628> his head<WH1538> in the house<WH1004> of Dagon.<WH1712>
When all Jabesh Gilead<WH3003> heard<WH8085> all that the Philistines<WH6430> had done<WH6213> to Saul,<WH7586>

all the valiant<WH2428> men<WH376> arose,<WH6965> and took away<WH5375> the body<WH1480> of Saul,<WH7586> and the bodies<WH1480> of his sons,<WH1121> and brought<WH935> them to Jabesh,<WH3003> and buried<WH6912> their bones<WH6106> under the oak<WH424> in Jabesh,<WH3003> and fasted<WH6684> seven<WH7651> days.<WH3117>

So Saul<WH7586> died<WH4191> for his trespass<WH4604> which he committed<WH4603> against Yahweh,<WH3068> because of the word<WH1697> of Yahweh,<WH3068> which he didn't<WH8104> keep; and also because he asked<WH7592> counsel of one who had a familiar spirit,<WH178> to inquire,<WH1875>
and didn't<WH1875> inquire of Yahweh:<WH3068> therefore he killed<WH4191> him,<WH5437> and turned the kingdom<WH4410> to David<WH1732> the son<WH1121> of Jesse.<WH3448>
